009package imagingbook.common.image.matching.lucaskanade;
010
011import ij.IJ;
012import ij.process.FloatProcessor;
013import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d;
014import imagingbook.common.geometry.basic.Pnt2d.PntDouble;
015import imagingbook.common.geometry.mappings.linear.ProjectiveMapping2D;
016import imagingbook.common.ij.IjUtils;
017import imagingbook.common.math.Matrix;
018
019
020/**
021 * Inverse Compositional Matcher, as described in Simon Baker and Iain Matthews, 
022 * "Lucas-Kanade 20 Years On: A Unifying Framework: Part 1", CMU-RI-TR-02-16 (2002)
023 *  @author Wilhelm Burger
024 *  @version 2014/02/08
025 */
026public class LucasKanadeInverseMatcher extends LucasKanadeMatcher {
027        
028        private int n;                                  // number of warp parameters
029        private float[][] Rx, Ry;               // gradient of reference image
030        private double[][] Hi;                  // inverse of cumulated Hessian matrix
031        private double[][][] S;                 // S[u][u][n] = the steepest descent image for dimension n at pos. u,v (same size as R)
032
033        private double qmag = Double.MAX_VALUE;         // magnitude of parameter difference vector
034        private double sqrError = Double.MAX_VALUE;     // squared sum of differences between I and R
035        
036        /**
037         * Creates a new matcher of type {@link LucasKanadeInverseMatcher}.
038         * @param I the search image (of type {@link FloatProcessor}).
039         * @param R the reference image (of type {@link FloatProcessor})
040         * @param params a parameter object of type  {@link LucasKanadeMatcher.Parameters}.
041         */
042        public LucasKanadeInverseMatcher(FloatProcessor I, FloatProcessor R, Parameters params) {
043                super(I, R, params);
044        }
045        
046        public LucasKanadeInverseMatcher(FloatProcessor I, FloatProcessor R) {
047                super(I, R, new Parameters());
048        }
049        
050        private void initializeMatch(ProjectiveMapping2D Tinit) {
051//              n = Tinit.getParameters().length;       // number of transformation parameters
052                n = getParameters(Tinit).length;        // number of transformation parameters
053                S = new double[wR][hR][];                       // S[u][v] holds a double vector of length n
054                Rx = gradientX(R).getFloatArray();      // gradient of R
055                Ry = gradientY(R).getFloatArray();
056                double[][] H = new double[n][n];        // cumulated Hessian matrix of size n x n (initially zero)
057                
058                ProjectiveMapping2D Tp = Tinit;
059                
060                for (int u = 0; u < wR; u++) {                  // for all coordinates (u,v) in R do
061                        for (int v = 0; v < hR; v++) {
062//                              double[] x = {u - xc, v - yc};  // position w.r.t. the center of R
063                                Pnt2d x = PntDouble.from(u - xc, v - yc);       // position w.r.t. the center of R
064                                double[] gradR = {Rx[u][v], Ry[u][v]};
065
066                                double[][] J = Tp.getJacobian(x);
067                                
068                                double[] sx = Matrix.multiply(gradR, J);                // column vector of length n (6)
069                                
070                                S[u][v] = sx;                                                                   // keep for use in main loop
071                                double[][] Hxy = Matrix.outerProduct(sx, sx);
072                                
073                                H = Matrix.add(H, Hxy);                                                 // cumulate the Hessian
074                        }
075                }
076                
077                Hi = Matrix.inverse(H);                                                                 // inverse of Hessian
078                if (Hi == null) {
079                        IJ.log("singular Hessian!");
080                        throw new RuntimeException("could not invert Hessian");
081                }
082                
083                iteration = 0;
084                
085                if (params.showSteepestDescentImages) 
086                        showSteepestDescentImages(S);
087                if (params.showHessians) {
088                        IjUtils.createImage("H", H).show();
089                        IjUtils.createImage("Hi", Matrix.inverse(H)).show();
090                }
091        }
092        
093        @Override
094        public ProjectiveMapping2D iterateOnce(ProjectiveMapping2D Tp) {
095                if (iteration < 0) {
096                        initializeMatch(Tp);
097                }
098                iteration = iteration + 1;
099                double[] dp = new double[n];    // n-dim vector \delta_p = 0
100                sqrError = 0;
101                
102                // for all positions (u,v) in R do
103                for (int u = 0; u < wR; u++) {
104                        for (int v = 0; v < hR; v++) {
105                                
106                                // get coordinate relative to center of R
107                                Pnt2d x = PntDouble.from(u - xc, v - yc);
108                                
109                                // warp I to I' (onto R)
110                                Pnt2d xT = Tp.applyTo(x);               // warp from x -> x'
111
112                                // calculate pixel difference d for pos. (u,v)
113                                double d = I.getInterpolatedValue(xT.getX(), xT.getY()) - R.getf(u, v);
114                                sqrError = sqrError + d * d;
115                                
116                                // multiply the pixel difference d with the corresponding steepest descent image sx
117                                // and sum into dp:
118                                double[] sx = S[u][v];
119                                dp = Matrix.add(dp, Matrix.multiply(d, sx));
120                        }
121                }
122                
123                // estimate the parameter difference vector qopt:
124                double[] qopt = Matrix.multiply(Hi, dp);
125                if (params.debug) IJ.log("qopt  = " + Matrix.toString(qopt));
126                
127                // measure the magnitude of the difference vector:
128                qmag = Matrix.normL2squared(qopt);
129                
130                // Calculate the warp parameters p', such that T_p'(x) = T_p (T^-1_q (x), for any point x.
131                ProjectiveMapping2D Tqopt = toProjectiveMap(qopt);
132                ProjectiveMapping2D Tqopti = Tqopt.getInverse();
133                return Tqopti.concat(Tp);
134        }
135        
136        @Override
137        public boolean hasConverged() {
138                return (qmag < params.tolerance);
139        }
140        
141        @Override
142        public double getRmsError() {
143                return Math.sqrt(sqrError);
144        }
145        
146}
